Oxymorphone



COMMON & BRAND NAMES

Numorphan (injectable solution); Opana (tablet)

EFFECTS CLASSIFICATION

Opioid Analgesic

CHEMICAL NAME

4,5-epoxy-3,14-dihydroxy-17-methylmorphinan-6-one

DESCRIPTION

content:
Drug: Oxymorphone | cid: 5284604
Source: erowid | Source description: Information about Oxymorphone (Opana) including uses, images, dosage, effects, legal status, and links to other resources.
Erowid name: oxymorphone
Category: PHARMS
Field: MainPage

                    Text: 
                    COMMON & BRAND NAMES

Numorphan (injectable solution); Opana (tablet)

EFFECTS CLASSIFICATION

Opioid Analgesic

CHEMICAL NAME

4,5-epoxy-3,14-dihydroxy-17-methylmorphinan-6-one

DESCRIPTION

Oxymorphone, a semisynthetic opioid analgesic 10 times more potent than morphine, is used in the treatment of moderate to severe pain. It is sometimes used as an adjunct to anesthesia.

MEDIA COVERAGE #

                    Context: 
                    This chunk is the main content section of Erowid's oxymorphone (Opana, Numorphan) information page within the Pharmaceuticals Vault. It provides an overview of the substance, including its chemical classification, common and brand names, description, related vaults, links to further information, user experiences, and external resources. This section directly follows the page heading and precedes resource links, helping users quickly understand oxymorphone's basic properties, uses, and where to find additional details or personal accounts.
